intro: Chevaliera magdalenae var. quadricolor, commonly known as the Magdalenae Four-color Balsam, is a hybrid plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is characterized by its striking, multicolored flowers that typically display shades of red, yellow, and white. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full shade for optimal growth.
